messages.message: Hi, Iâ€™m facing some issues extracting the cost from this document using Table; it seems to rename the title of the table something that is not useable; is there anyway to avoid this behaviour

@Lalit @Prashant Kikani
For this is there a way for this detection that second row is actually a header and then adjust that in table ingestion. ?

@Gwen
Currently this is more of a limitation with table headers as there are two levels of columns.

This is an FR issue. *`Permanent Sources`* is the parent header and FR confuses this table as a table with those 2 parent columns.

> Currently this is more of a limitation with table headers as there are two levels of columns.
Yes, we need to handle this in future. Need to do the header row detection(using LLM), like we do in Excel. Right now, we assume 1st row is the header.

Considering we see individual columns here and cell values as "*Permanant Sources",* *"Permanent Sources.1", "Permanent Sources.2" ..* it looks like we are selecting the upper cell here ? Can you confirm @Yash Aggarwal @Abhishek?
